intro: Albrandia gaudichaudii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year in warm climates. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, hairy seeds. Albrandia gaudichaudii is native to regions of South America and is often found in moist, shady environments.
